<nation>England</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>The original HSE covered adults (aged 16 and over) and children (aged 10-15 years) living in private households in England during 2000-2001 (fieldwork extended to March 2002).</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>The main HSE is a repeated cross-sectional series, conducted annually. This study includes variables from the HSE between 2000 and 2001/2.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details.</sampProc>         <deviat>28,451 (obtained). The data include cases from the general population sample and the boost sample of elderly people in the HSE 2000.</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <collMode>The original HSE was conducted using Face-to-face interview; Self-completion; Clinical measurements and Physical measurements.</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>This teaching dataset is an edited version of the HSEs 2000 and 2001, held under SNs 4628 and 4487 respectively.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>Weighting used (variable 'weight'). See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Open</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is not required.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>This unrestricted access data collection is freely available to download under an <a href="http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/2/" title="Open Government Licence">Open Government Licence</a> from the UK Data Service. Note that the files should be unzipped/saved to the C: drive of the computer to be used; all syntax assumes files are saved at this location.</conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>6765 Health Survey for England, 2003-2005: Multilevel Modelling Teaching Dataset </relStdy>       <relStdy>7402 Health Survey for England, 2011: Teaching Dataset </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
